Posts.Title: Is swap surgery as bad as bilateral mastectomy? k8sonny k8sonny

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2011 02:41AM corian68 wrote: K8sonny I just had my exchange last Friday the 8th. And girl.....it was nothing compared to my BLMX!!!! Outpatient & I was up feeling good by Sunday. I am not even a week out and I just took my dog to the groomer. It feels so good to have squishy smaller boobs! They feel so real it's crazy. Hang in there, it's all worth it;)
Posts.Title: Is swap surgery as bad as bilateral mastectomy? k8sonny k8sonny

Posts.Content: May 12, 2011 11:20PM corian68 wrote: Hi;) The waiting is awful! I was diagnosed @ 42 last Dec. And had to wait until Feb. For BMX because of insurance...Sucked. Maybe it is just their policy to have the testing done first? I have a strong family history with BC. My Mother was also diagnosed with the exact same cancer as mine @ 59, last year. She is BRCA Neg. Her sister, DX'd @ 27 and passed at 30. She died before genetic testing was available so her BRCA is unknown? I had my test done 2 weeks ago & just learned I am BRCA2 Neg but BRCA1 is some mystery mutation? They can't identify what kind of mutation , so they asked if I would be part of some study...sure why not? :D I know that 2 weeks is like an eternity when you're waiting! But you will be ok! I couldn't sleep or eat or carry on a conversation while in ' limbo'. But now I am great & you will be too! I am so glad my cancer is gone. I have tissue expanders in now , having them filled every couple of weeks. People that haven't seen me since before surgery, have no idea unless I tell them I've had a mastectomy. While you are waiting, start researching everything, learning saved me & my mind. Learn about surgery options, hormone treatments..traditional & alternative therapies. And remember you have all of us that understand through experience. You are not alone! Hugs ;) IDC stage 1 grade 3 ER+PR+ HER2-.
Posts.Title: Worth the wait for MRI and BRCA results? dianamaps whatsnext

Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2011 02:00AM corian68 wrote: What a jack ass! I am so sorry to hear this, doctors really need to examine their delivery system of shitty news! We are more than just a file or a diagnosis. I got a similar call on a Friday for my diagnosis. The Nurse said my path was in and they had to see me on Monday even though they knew I was catching a 6 pm flight on the Monday. They wouldn't tell me over the phone & said it was VERY important I come in before my flight. They didn't realize they were already telling me it was malignant. Obviously they had no concern of what that weekend would do to me...... I am sorry you have to go through this, it is not fair at all.... You are not alone ( hugs)

Posts.Title: Cheating Husband teamnana car2tenn

Posts.Content: May 16, 2011 11:56AM corian68 wrote: I have been following this story & it's heart breaking. Regardless of marital issues ( on both sides) this decision was based on the judges opinion to spare the children more grief. Taking them away from their Mother will not make their grief any less. This is also their experience not just their Mother's or ex husband's. My best friend passed from BC, her 8 year old daughter was there by her side. It was very painful but there were beautiful events as well. At the end, her 8 year old crawled in bed with her and told her that it was ok for her to go. She said the kids in Heaven need a Mommy Angel to help them. 5 minutes later she was gone......painful? Yes, but their experience, not ours to judge or try to make better....sometimes things just aren't better.

Posts.Content: May 17, 2011 02:22AM - edited May 17, 2011 02:23AM by corian68 Hi there sweetie;) It is scary when we feel ' foreigners' in our breast! I had something similar when I was young. Turned out to be a cyst. I am very glad you went in for an ultrasound. It's always better to know for sure what's going on with your body. This time around When I felt my malignant 9mm lump. It didn't hurt at all and it felt like bebe placed just under my skin. No redness or swelling. I am not a doctor but it does sound like it is cystic or something like that. And you are awesome to press on for screening....never let them tell you that you are too young. I will say a prayer for you tonight, you will be ok;) peace girlfriend!

Posts.Content: May 8, 2011 10:48PM corian68 wrote: Thank you Whippetmom! I was hoping that would be my case too. I called my PS and asked if I could see him sooner than the 18th & give it a little more water. Just in case there was a corner/ridge that could be popped out of it's position? He said it would just hurt more....I think he's just too busy to try. I tried to manipulate the darn thing myself, the pain is becoming a little more ' dull' then the stabbing / piercing pain. Thanks for responding! Cori
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome (PMPS) Deeds Lezza13

Posts.Content: May 8, 2011 03:03AM corian68 wrote: Reading all these posts about pain just breaks my heart.....I try to stay very positive but sometimes I just want to yell...it's not flipping fair...enough is enough! I was diagnosed Dec 2010 with DCIS stage 1. had BLMX Feb 2011 with tissue expanders. We have been expanding slowly for the last couple of months with no problems until now. My last fill 2 weeks ago caused some discomfort. The standard tight feeling. Then all of a sudden I was and am coming out of my skin! My left breast is killing me. It's the strangest pain. Not aching like normal pain but I have a spot that feels like it's on my chest wall under the expanders that feels broken ;(. When I take a breath, it feels like my rib is broke, sticking me. I haven't been on pain med's so I called the doctor. He prescribed Vicodin. It's not touching the pain! I don't have a fever & there's no redness. The Dr. Says it's probably a irritated spot where the expander is rubbing & making a sore spot? This hurts like he'll, has anyone else put there experienced anything like this? thanks - Cori
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome (PMPS) Deeds Lezza13

Posts.Content: May 17, 2011 12:18AM corian68 wrote: Luann- Hi again! I didn't mention earlier cuz who wants to sound like a total basket case, right? Lol! When I was 18 DX'd with Endometriosis. I was DX'd with Fibro & RA when I was 27. At 42 here come BC...Mac Daddy! They must be connected...they are all in the same damn body! Haha! I have been on synthetic hormones almost my whole life trying to control Endo. Been on everything under the Sun for Fibro & RA. Endo is a hormonal disease and the autoimmune disorder is inflammation. Too much TNF. Sounds like a recipe for BC if you ask me! That is the biggest reason as we discussed earlier, that I am trying to start treatment from a clean slate. Detox my body and check everything first. We will achieve good health...we wil!
